p: Diabetes mellitus is a long-term metabolic disorder characterized by elevated blood glucose concentration that results from absolute insulin deficiency or insufficient insulin secretion and/or insulin sensitivity [ 6]. According to Schmeltz and Metzger [ 7], a new classification of diabetes relies on etiology and pathophysiology, without distinction regarding age of onset or type of treatment. The main categories of diabetes are type 1, type 2, double (hybrid), and gestational diabetes mellitus.
